parameters.name: name required
parameters.description: string — Primary name of the group. Maximum 140 characters

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: string — A subheading for the group. Maximum 255 characters

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: string — GroupMe Image Service URL

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: boolean — If you pass a true value for share , we'll generate a share URL. Anybody with this URL can join the group.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: integer — Fetch a particular page of results. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: integer — Define page size. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: avatar_url
parameters.description: string — URL to valid JPG/PNG/GIF image. URL will be converted into an image service link (http://i.groupme.com/....)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: string — Name must be of the form FirstName LastName

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: string — Email address. Must be in name@domain.com form.

parameters.name: zip_code
parameters.description: string — Zip code.

parameters.name: duration required
parameters.description: integer

parameters.name: registration_id
parameters.description: string — The push notification ID/token that should be suppressed during SMS mode. If this is omitted, both SMS and push notifications will be delivered to the device.

parameters.name: period required
parameters.description: string — one of: 'day', 'week', or 'month'

parameters.name: user required
parameters.description: string — your user id.

parameters.name: otherUser required
parameters.description: string — user id of person you want to block.

parameters.name: requests required
parameters.description:
array — One request is object where user_id is the new owner who must be active member of a group specified by group_id . object group_id (string) required
owner_id (string) required

parameters.name: members
parameters.description:
array — nickname is required. You must use one of the following identifiers: user_id , phone_number , or email . object nickname (string) required
user_id (string)
phone_number (string)
email (string)
guid (string)

parameters.name: results_id required
parameters.description: string — This is the guid that's returned from an add request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: integer — Page number

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: integer — Number of chats per page

parameters.name: group_id required
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: bot_id required
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: text required
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: picture_url
parameters.description: string — Image must be processed through image service .

parameters.name: source_guid required
parameters.description: string — This is used for client-side deduplication.

parameters.name: recipient_id required
parameters.description: string — The GroupMe user ID of the recipient of this message.

parameters.name: text required
parameters.description: string — This can be omitted if at least one attachment is present.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description:
array — A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it. object type (string) — “image” required
url (string) required — Must be an image service (i.groupme.com) URL

object type (string) — “location” required
name (string) required
lat (string) required
lng (string) required

object type (string) — “emoji” required
placeholder (string) — “☃” required
charmap (array) — “[{pack_id},{offset}]” required

parameters.name: other_user_id required
parameters.description: string — The other participant in the conversation.

parameters.name: before_id
parameters.description: string — Returns 20 messages created before the given message ID

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: string — Returns 20 messages created after the given message ID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: office_mode
parameters.description: boolean

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: boolean — If you pass a true value for share , we'll generate a share URL. Anybody with this URL can join the group.

parameters.name: membership_id required
parameters.description: string — Please note that this isn't the same as the user ID. In the members key in the group JSON, this is the id value, not the user_id .

parameters.name: id required
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: source_guid required
parameters.description: string — Client-side IDs for messages. This can be used by clients to set their own identifiers on messages, but the server also scans these for de-duplication. That is, if two messages are sent with the same source_guid within one minute of each other, the second message will fail with a 409 Conflict response. So it's important to set this to a unique value for each message.

parameters.name: text required
parameters.description: string — This can be omitted if at least one attachment is present. The maximum length is 1,000 characters.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description:
array — A polymorphic list of attachments (locations, images, etc). You may have You may have more than one of any type of attachment, provided clients can display it. object type (string) — “image” required
url (string) required — Must be an image service (i.groupme.com) URL

object type (string) — “location” required
name (string) required
lat (string) required
lng (string) required

object type (string) — “split” required
token (string) required

object type (string) — “emoji” required
placeholder (string) — “☃” required
charmap (array) — “[{pack_id},{offset}]” required

parameters.name: before_id
parameters.description: string — Returns messages created before the given message ID

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: string — Returns most recent messages created after the given message ID

parameters.name: after_id
parameters.description: string — Returns messages created immediately after the given message ID

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: integer — Number of messages returned. Default is 20. Max is 100.

parameters.description: string
